title: MySQL
description: Real-time logging and monitoring for Docker in the browser

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.label: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.description: This variable is optional and allows you to specify the name of a database to be created on image startup. If a user/password was supplied (see below) then that user will be granted superuser access (corresponding to GRANT ALL) to this database

env.name: MYSQL_USER
env.label: MYSQL_USER
env.description: These variables are optional, used in conjunction to create a new user and to set that user's password. This user will be granted superuser permissions (see above) for the database specified by the MYSQL_DATABASE variable. Both variables are required for a user to be created

env.name: MYSQL_PASSWORD
env.label: MYSQL_PASSWORD
env.description: These variables are optional, used in conjunction to create a new user and to set that user's password. This user will be granted superuser permissions (see above) for the database specified by the MYSQL_DATABASE variable. Both variables are required for a user to be created

env.name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.description: This variable is mandatory and specifies the password that will be set for the MySQL root superuser account

env.name: MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: MYSQL_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.description: Generate a random initial password for the root user

env.name: MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD
env.label: MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD
env.description: Allow the container to be started with a blank password for the root user

env.name: MYSQL_ONETIME_PASSWORD
env.label: MYSQL_ONETIME_PASSWORD
env.description: Sets root (not the user specified in MYSQL_USER!) user as expired once init is complete, forcing a password change on first login

env.name: MYSQL_INITDB_SKIP_TZINFO
env.label: MYSQL_INITDB_SKIP_TZINFO
env.description: By default, the entrypoint script automatically loads the timezone data needed for the CONVERT_TZ() function, set to yest will disables timezone loading
